title: Tracking the Implementation of the AI Executive Order
originSummary: Stanford University has created a tracker to monitor the implementation of the White House Executive Order on AI, providing insights into the government's priorities.
The tracker analyzes the 150 requirements outlined in the executive order, focusing on areas like attracting AI talent, safety and security, consumer rights, and US leadership in AI governance.

The tracker shows that responsibility for implementing these requirements is distributed among various federal agencies and entities, with ambitious deadlines set for action, aiming to improve transparency and accountability in the government's efforts to fulfill the executive order.

title: Biden's AI Executive Order Impact on Energy Sector
originSummary: President Biden's executive order on AI has implications for the energy sector, specifically addressing AI system threats to critical infrastructure.
The order instructs the Department of Energy to establish rigorous standards for the safe deployment of AI systems.

Energy sector companies should implement their own AI governance processes, focusing on data privacy and security, as well as transparency in AI model training. The goal is to balance public security, privacy, and economic growth with the use of AI in the energy sector.

title: VC-Led Startup Safety Commitments: Boon or Bane for AI Acceleration?
originSummary: A group of over 40 venture capital firms, including General Catalyst and Felicis Ventures, have agreed to voluntary commitments for responsible AI development.
The commitments, developed with input from the US Department of Commerce, focus on five key areas: responsible AI, transparency, risk assessment, auditing, and continuous improvement.
There is a debate within the AI startup community regarding the effectiveness of these commitments, with concerns that they may hinder AI safety rather than enhance it.

title: Mayor Adams Launches AI Initiative to Improve City Services and Reach Diverse Language Speakers
originSummary: Mayor Eric Adams of New York City has launched an AI initiative to enhance city services and cater to diverse language speakers.
The initiative includes the use of robocalls in multiple languages, although some criticize the fact that Mayor Adams himself does not speak those languages.
The AI action plan consists of 37 phased actions to assess AI tools, establish governance, build AI knowledge in government, enable responsible procurement, and communicate progress.

title: Mitigating Risks in Contracting for AI Technologies: Top 5 Best Practices
originSummary: Contracting for AI technologies carries various risks, including intellectual property infringement, ownership disputes, confidentiality breaches, inaccurate output, unintended biases, and noncompliance with laws and regulations.

To mitigate these risks, it is recommended to consider the right technology framework, conduct AI-specific due diligence on the vendor, include an AI governance framework, address evolving regulatory requirements, and incorporate AI-specific terms, rights, and remedies in the contract.
Implementing these five best practices can help organizations ensure a secure and successful AI technology contracting process.

title: U.K. summit falls short in addressing AI development and diversity
originSummary: The AI Safety Summit in the U.K. did not achieve significant results and lacked diverse representation.
The summit had the goal of discussing the progress of artificial intelligence and setting guidelines.
No meaningful outcomes emerged from the event, highlighting a possible gap in addressing AI safety and inclusivity.

title: Privacera Wins Gold Globee for Unified Data Security Platform
originSummary: Privacera has received the Gold Globee award at the 13th Annual Globee Business Awards for its Unified Data Security Platform.
The platform combines data discovery, protection, access, and reporting to enable the responsible utilization of data for AI applications.
Privacera is commended for its commitment to data security, governance, and compliance, as the Globee Awards recognize organizations for excellence in innovation, leadership, and customer service.
